item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 22, 2024 at 4:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. A data table thousands of years old (2020) (121 points | 34 comments)
2. Keeping a Changelog at Work (2020) (36 points | 12 comments)
3. City Roads: A tool to draw all roads in a city at once (138 points | 23 comments)
4. Dividing unsigned 8-bit numbers (103 points | 55 comments)
5. Query Apple's FindMy network with Python (335 points | 147 comments)
6. Ideas from "A Philosophy of Software Design" (88 points | 47 comments)
7. Enum of Arrays (69 points | 16 comments)
8. Show HN: Rivet Actors – Durable Objects build with Rust, FoundationDB, Isolates (88 points | 18 comments)
9. JEP 483: Ahead-of-Time Class Loading and Linking (50 points | 6 comments)
10. Rosetta 2 creator leaves Apple to work on Lean full-time (44 points | 14 comments)
11. Show HN: GitHub-assistant – Natural language questions from your GitHub data (9 points | 3 comments)
12. US judge finds NSO Group liable for hacking journalists via WhatsApp (501 points | 164 comments)
13. Train a Mnist VAE with C and CUDA (18 points | discuss)
14. Show HN: Eonfall – A new third-person co-op action game built for the web (144 points | 81 comments)
15. A curious case of O(N^2) behavior which should be O(N) (2023) (49 points | 8 comments)
16. How we made our AI code review bot stop leaving nitpicky comments (87 points | 56 comments)
17. Language and Personality (14 points | 9 comments)
18. Spherical Harmonics (28 points | 23 comments)
19. Show HN: Demo of my web game about social persuasion (57 points | 25 comments)
20. Translating 10M lines of Java to Kotlin (90 points | 74 comments)
21. Wuppertal's suspended monorail proved its doubters wrong [video] (47 points | 18 comments)
22. Cqd: Colour my __dir__ please (18 points | 3 comments)
23. Fault Report – and alternative to Result in F# (3 points | discuss)
24. Talking over a wall changed my direction as a programmer (66 points | 33 comments)
25. Richard Bellman on the Birth of Dynamic Programming (2002) [pdf] (21 points | 4 comments)
26. Introducing S2 (246 points | 130 comments)
27. Grammarly acquires Coda (96 points | 62 comments)
28. Turing Machines (64 points | 21 comments)
29. Takes on "Alignment Faking in Large Language Models" (7 points | 2 comments)
30. Generate Color Palettes from Text (16 points | 4 comments)
